Direct message the job poster from ShiftMed
Dominique Curtin
Talent Acquisition Leader | Job Match Maker | Crafting Talent Strategies | Startup Obsessed |
ShiftMed, the leading and fastest-growing nursing jobs platform in the U.S., is looking for a Director, Data, and Analysis to lead our growing Data Analyst team. ShiftMed’s mission is to revolutionize the nurse staffing business, leveraging our technology to empower healthcare professionals to take control of their schedules. Our app enables them to connect directly with facilities to find the best opportunities that fit their needs while earning approximately 20% higher than the industry average. The ideal candidate will be an experienced manager who is skilled at people management and data analysis. They will be a data-driven self-starter, who has strong analytical skills and provides detailed analysis. Our data includes operational, financial, marketing, and sales datasets as well as structured, external data support. You will have access to the Red Stripe data warehouse as well as Tableau with tasks to build out our bi tool. The successful candidate will lead and manage our data analysts and help turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. We need someone to help develop analysis and reporting capabilities and grow and mentor our team. They will monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements across all areas of the business. They will also be managing the team of analysts, driving process changes to support ShiftMed growth. If this sounds like you, please apply today – we can’t wait to meet you!Who we are:Our Mission is to empower healthcare professionals to make a living doing what they love, when and where they want.In the news:Featured on NBC's Today ShowRecognized on Inc. 5000 fastest-growing company list!Business Insider exclusive article on or annual state of nursing surveyShiftMed has been featured in media outlets such as USA Today, Yahoo! News, Huffington Post’s Thrive Global, Fortune, Nasdaq TradeTalks, Skilled Nursing News, and Home Health Care NewsShiftMed Setting a New Standard:350,000+ (and counting!) w2 credentialed workersOver 10,000,000 hours of care delivered158 markets across 30 states nationwide (and growing!)$46,000,000 YTD cost savings for our clientsExclusive Uber Health Partnership, breaking the transportation barrier for healthcare professionalsAbout your role: Manage a team of analysts Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports Build time-series forecasting models to help drive outcomes and support financial decisions Be part of a team that is developing reports, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources as needed Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in data sets Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Experience: Expert in SQL Expert in data report building Understanding of Python and/or other data processing languages Solid knowledge of RedStripe or other data reporting warehouse Solid knowledge of dbt or other data automation tools Ability to create and execute a successful visualization strategy Minimum 5 years of proven working experience as a data analyst in technical companies Technical expertise in data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings What you’ll love:Competitive salaryComprehensive health insuranceGenerous PTO10 Holiday paid days off401k with company matchCompany-sponsored life insurance, long-term and short-term disabilityCompany provided laptopTremendous growth opportunities to be with a thriving young company disrupting the Healthtech space100% Remote work flexibilityWhen you join our company, you’re not just accepting a job. You are making a career move.ShiftMed is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the US. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment visa at this time.
